tutorial.title: Neural Network Reprogrammability: A Unified Framework for Parameter-Efficient Foundation Model Adaptation
tutorial.description: This tutorial provides a comprehensive introduction to neural network reprogrammability, covering theoretical foundations, practical implementation, and trustworthiness implications. Learn how to leverage input transformations and output alignment to efficiently adapt frozen pre-trained models for new tasks without parameter updates.

sessions.title: Foundations of Reprogrammability
topics: Adaptation bottleneck and paradigm shift from fine-tuning to reprogramming
From vulnerability to strength: leveraging input sensitivity for model adaptation
Examples across modalities: ICL (fixed weights) vs MR (learnable transformations)
Formal decomposition framework: f' = O ∘ f_pre ∘ I

sessions.title: Mechanics: Input Manipulation and Output Alignment
topics: Comprehensive taxonomy of Input Manipulation: location, operator, configuration
Deep dive case study: Vision Transformer visual prompt injection techniques
Performance-efficiency trade-offs: data requirements, compute costs, accuracy
Hands-on implementation examples and best practices

sessions.title: Implications: Towards Trustworthy AI
topics: Holistic trustworthiness evaluation: robustness, security, fairness perspectives
Real-world applications: bioinformatics, time series analysis, multimodal learning
Emerging challenges: adversarial reprogramming, privacy implications
Future research directions and open challenges in the field

speakers.name: Feng Liu
speakers.affiliation: The University of Melbourne; RIKEN AIP
speakers.bio: Feng Liu is a researcher focusing on neural network adaptation and parameter efficiency. His work spans foundation model reprogramming, few-shot learning, and efficient transfer learning methods. He has published extensively on model reprogramming techniques and their theoretical foundations.

speakers.name: Zesheng Ye
speakers.bio: Zesheng Ye specializes in input manipulation and output alignment mechanisms for neural network reprogramming. His research focuses on developing practical implementation frameworks and understanding the mechanics behind successful model reprogramming.

speakers.name: Pin-Yu Chen
speakers.affiliation: IBM Research AI; MIT-IBM Watson AI Lab
speakers.bio: Pin-Yu Chen researches trustworthy AI and adversarial machine learning. He explores the security and robustness implications of neural network reprogramming, with particular focus on adversarial reprogramming and defense mechanisms.

learning_outcomes: Understand the unified reprogrammability framework and its theoretical foundations
Master the taxonomy of input manipulation techniques across different domains
Apply reprogramming methods to real-world scenarios and evaluate trade-offs
Assess trustworthiness implications including robustness and security considerations
Implement practical solutions using provided code examples and frameworks
